column4: I've been using this computer for Windows XP for a few months now, and I've just installed Ubuntu on another drive. I'm wondering how to set up a dual boot for the two systems. Do I have to use GRUB?
No, there are other alternatives.  Yes, grub is the preferred method.
grub is installable from the ubuntu CD, and unless you opted out of it, was already installed, anyway...
did he burn at 4x or so?  does the CD integrity check?
